intro: Agropyron enysii, commonly known as Enys' wheatgrass, is a perennial grass species native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny grains. It is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for wildlife. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
